newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed on Thursday in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said.

"The interbank rate slipped slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly higher but bond prices were narrowly mixed. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 1.68/1.63 percent compared with Wednesday's yield of 1.63/1.58 percent and one-year at a yield of 1.70/1.65 percent against 1.67/1.62 percent.
Among bonds, April 1999 was unchanged from Wednesday's close of S$99.55/99.60.
September 2001 ended at S$96.66/96.71 versus Wednesday's close of S$96.70/96.75 and June 2003 at S$94.83/94.88 against S$94.75/94.80.
The interbank rate slipped slightly to 3-7/16 3-5/16 percent from 3-5/8 3-1/2 percent.
